question0.name: Question 1
question0.details: Multiple pulmonary cysts which are: Lower zone predominant Subpleural predilection- paramediastinal and perifissural location        Thin-walled, variable in size, round or elongated, sometimes multilobulated or multiseptate

question1.name: Question 2
question1.details: ‘Gull- wing appearance’ at the interphalangeal joints is characteristic of this condition. Subchondral erosions centralls and lateral osteophyte formation. Can be seen in psoariatic/ rheumatoid arthritis

question2.name: Question 3
question2.details: Multiple enchondromas and soft- tissue phelobliths (which represent hemangiomas)

question3.name: Question 4
question3.details: A well- defined lesion in the pancreas with striking resemblance to the intensity of the spleen
